# Michael Izza



**Michael Donald McCartney Izza** CBE (born December 1960) is the former CEO of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (ICAEW). [S2] ## Early life and education

Born in Bolton, Izza gained a law degree from Durham University, during which time he was also President of Durham Students' Union. [S3] ## Career

Upon graduation in 1983, Izza trained as a chartered accountant with Coopers & Lybrand in Manchester (now PwC). [S4] Izza joined Canadian brewing company John Labatt Ltd. [S5] in 1989, becoming European vice president finance, progressing to managing director of the firm's European retail arm in 1992. [S6] In 1997, Izza joined Spring Group Plc - as managing director of Spring Skills - then the UK's largest vocational training business - then progressing to group roles including finance director. [S7] ## ICAEW

Izza joined ICAEW in 2002 as executive director of finance and operations, becoming chief operating officer in 2004 and chief executive in 2006. [S8] In 2008 and 2009, following the financial crisis, Izza chaired three HM Treasury working groups tasked with identifying independent valuers for Northern Rock, Bradford & Bingley and Dunfermline Building Society. [S9] In 2009, Izza chaired an international corporate governance taskforce set up by the Leading Group of Nations to examine the relative merits of an international financial transactions tax. [S10] Izza was a member of the UK Government's Small Business Economic Forum. [S11] As of February 2019, Izza is a member of the advisory group supporting the UK Government's independent review into the quality and effectiveness of audit, led by Sir Donald Brydon. [S12] Izza chairs Chartered Accountants Worldwide (CAW). [S13] He is also executive director of the Consultative Committee of Accountancy Bodies (CCAB) and a board member of the Global Accounting Alliance (GAA). [S14] Izza is a member of the Worshipful Company of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales, one of the livery companies of the City of London. [S15] ## Personal life

Izza is married with two children. [S16] Izza has been a trustee of several charities, and is currently on the trustee board of Moorfields Eye Charity, which supports Moorfields Eye Hospital.
